article.headline: Missouri St. 71, N. Iowa 54
article.story: SPRINGFIELD, Mo. (AP) -- Dale Lamberth scored 20 points and had nine rebounds to help Missouri State to a 71-54 win over Northern Iowa on Saturday night. The win snapped a four-game losing streak for the Bears (12-13, 5-8 Missouri Valley Conference). Missouri State led 39-30 at halftime and pushed the lead to 24 midway through the second half. The Bears held Northern Iowa to three field goals over an 11-minute span to start the second half. Deven Mitchell had 13 points for Missouri State, going over the 1,000-point mark for his career. Justin Fuehrmeyer had 11 points and eight assists for the Bears. The Panthers (14-10, 6-7) were led by 11 points apiece from Adam Viet and Jared Josten. Northern Iowa was 8-for-21 (38 percent) from the 3-point line but was beaten 38-22 on the boards. Missouri State shot 26-for-53 (49 percent) from the field and 9-for-18 from the 3-point line. The Bears used a 14-3 run midway through the first half to build a nine-point lead. Northern Iowa cut it to 33-26 with 2:56 left, but 3-pointers by Fuehrmeyer and Spencer Laurie gave Missouri State its biggest lead of the half at 13.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
